(Leiden, Elzevier, 1635)]] '''Franco Petri Burgersdijk''' or '''Franciscus Burgersdicius''', born '''Franck Pieterszoon Burgersdijk''' (3 May 1590 – 19 February 1635), was a [[Netherlands|Dutch]] [[logician]]. ==Life== Burgersdijk was born in [[De Lier]]. He was a student of Jacchaeus ([[Gilbert Jack]]).http://genealogy.math.ndsu.nodak.edu/id.php?id=114992 Burgersdijk finished his studies at the [[University of Leiden]] in 1610. He left to further study [[theology]] at the [[Saumur|University of Saumur]], where he became professor of [[philosophy]] in 1614. After five years he returned to [[Leiden]], where he accepted the chair of [[logic]] and moral philosophy, and afterwards that of [[natural philosophy]]. He died in Leiden. ==Works== * ''Institutionum logicarum libri duo'' (Leiden 1626, 1635, 1646) (at one time widely used) * ''Institutionum metaphysicarum libri duo'' (Leiden 1647, 1653, 1657) * {{Cite book | publisher = Bonaventura Elzevier, Abraham Elzevier | language = la | title = Idea philosophiae moralis | date = 1644 | url = http://gutenberg.beic.it/webclient/DeliveryManager?pid=1234619 }} * {{Cite book | publisher = Bonaventura Elzevier, Abraham Elzevier | language = la | title = Idea philosophiae naturalis, sive Methodus definitionum et controversiarum phisicarum | date = 1652 | url = http://gutenberg.beic.it/webclient/DeliveryManager?pid=77503 }} ==References== * Egbert P.
